title: Python Implementation of Various Denoising Filters for HR(S)TEM images
content: Denoising high-resolution transmission electron microscopy (HRTEM) images has been common practice in image analysis, especially when the electron dose needs to be compromised with sample stability, carbon contamination, or fast in-situ observation. Since the noise and crystalline signals are usually distinguishable in the frequency domain, filtering algorithms have been developed to reduce noise while preserving the crystalline features based on the Fourier transform of the raw images.
